title: Leader in Renewable Energy
description: In 2021, Bhutan achieved 100% renewable electricity output, with 99.99% of its electricity produced from hydroelectric sources.

title: Efficient Business Licensing
description: In 2015, Bhutan required only 1.2 days to obtain an operating license, showcasing its efficient business environment.

title: High External Debt Burden
description: In 2023, Bhutan's present value of external debt was 332.14% of its exports of goods, services, and primary income, indicating a significant debt burden.

title: Strong Regional Trade Ties
description: In 2023, 95.89% of Bhutan's merchandise exports were directed to low- and middle-income economies in South Asia, highlighting strong regional trade connections.

title: Minimal Corruption in Business
description: As of 2015, only 0.1% of firms in Bhutan reported making informal payments to public officials, indicating low levels of corruption.

title: High Dependency on South Asian Imports
description: In 2023, 91.50% of Bhutan's merchandise imports came from low- and middle-income economies in South Asia, showing a reliance on regional imports.

title: Moderate Public Administration Quality
description: In 2023, Bhutan received a CPIA quality of public administration rating of 4 out of 6, indicating moderate effectiveness.

title: Significant Private Sector Investment
description: In 2022, Bhutan's gross fixed capital formation in the private sector was 43.16% of GDP, reflecting substantial private investment.

title: High Time Spent on Government Regulations
description: In 2015, senior management in Bhutan spent 28.8% of their time dealing with government regulations, indicating a regulatory burden.

title: Low Intellectual Property Receipts
description: In 2024, Bhutan had a negative balance of -$8,581.42 in charges for the use of intellectual property, suggesting limited IP revenue.
